sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: At the Rafah border crossing with Egypt, these families with international passports are desperate to get out of Gaza and reach safety.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But for now it's closed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Egypt says airstrikes by Israel near the crossing make it too dangerous to open, and truckloads of humanitarian aid remain backed up on the Egyptian side. والله أنا بناتي عملوا تنصيق مع وزارة الخارجية في ألمانيا على أساس أنه أطلع قالوا لي يا ماما أطلع من 12 إلى 5 وللأسف أجينا لقينا كله مسكر يعني ليه بضحكوا على العالم وبقولوا كذا وكذا وكذا وما فيه على الأقل يساعدوا الناس تطلع يطلعوا بها إحنا مش شردين من أي مكان إحنا بس بدنا نطلع جينا هون زيارة لأهلنا إلنا شهرين قامت الحرب هذا علينا ضيعونا معنا شوية فلوس طارن لا مية ولا أكل ولا شرب ولا تليفون ولا نت ولا أي حاجة لأن واحد بعد ما شاف الوضع في غزة البيوت بتتهدى وناس بتموت والحمد لله رب العالمين طلعنا منها بخير As the humanitarian situation worsens in Gaza, Egypt is coming under more and more pressure to open the crossing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But Cairo says it already hosts nine million refugees and it can't let in large numbers of Palestinians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Like every Saturday in Tel Aviv for the past 39 weeks, political activists have come together to protest the government

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: in front of the Israeli Defense Ministry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But for the first Sabbat, the Jewish day of rest since Hamas' attack a week ago, they have come to support the families of hostages and demand their immediate release.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This is my daughter, Liri Elbad.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: She was kidnapped in her pyjamas early morning to Gaza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And I want her back now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: She was in the military.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: She was in the army base.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: She's 18 years old.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: She don't want to fight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I believe also in Gaza, they don't want to fight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Nobody want to fight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Everybody just want to leave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Avishai's wife and two children were abducted in their home near the border with Gaza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He's not heard from them since.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: There is a reason that it has been done.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Somebody or something is trying to tell us something.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And what I want to believe is trying to tell us peace, not war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We're all humans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Nobody wants dead children." The fact that they're dehumanizing all the Gazans and all the Palestinians is actually, at the end, it will be against Israelis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: To be against Hamas does not mean that we have to kill one child in Gaza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: At least 150 hostages were abducted by Hamas last week, and the militant group claims that more than 20 of them have since been killed in Israeli airstrikes on the Gaza Strip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: There's more than a lot of deportions here from the families who are demanding the release of their relatives who were taken hostage, but everyone we've spoken to are also demanding for the politics which they say have contributed to what's happened to stop.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: I'm Varig Goria in Tel Aviv for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Polls are voting in what has been touted as its most important election in decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Polish nationals went to the poll.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Today they will decide whether they will elect the conservative, low-and-justice party government for the third time or give the majority to the more liberal opposition coalition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: European participants, aid to Ukraine and abortion rights are some are solved issues that have deeply polarized Polish citizens who hope for a bright future for their children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: What is important? I want a better Poland than it has been so far. I want my children to live in a free, democratic and smiling country. so that people don't look at themselves as wolves because they have different political preferences.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I think these are the most important elections and we all have to go to them.
